headline: Progressive Insurance® Intends to Hire More Than 12,000 People in 2025 to Support Company's Continued Growth
summary: Progressive Insurance intends to hire thousands of people in 2025 to support its continued year-over-year growth. In addition to its growth-driven hiring plans, the No. 2 auto insurer in the U.S. continues its commitment to flexible workplace offerings with a mix of remote, in-office and hybrid roles available across claims, customer care, IT, analyst, legal, and corporate functions.

headline: Think Progressive Stock Is Expensive? This Chart Might Change Your Mind.
summary: Investors have been drawn to Progressive (NYSE: PGR) stock lately, in part because the insurer posted some encouraging numbers in its first-quarter earnings report.  At the moment, on several valuation metrics, Progressive is more expensive than several well-known peers.  Insurance companies that offer auto coverage -- a Progressive strength -- rebounded from the stay-at-home pandemic era quite nicely (although much of this has to do with the unpopular rate increases that have been common).
